entry.value: import pandas as pd%%00010import zipfile%%00010import lxml.etree%%00010import numpy as np%%00010%%00010datafolder = flow_variables['module']+'/data'%%00010trigrams = {'agriculture':'agr',%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009'buildings':'bld',%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009'climate':'clm',%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009'electricity_supply':'elc',%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009'employment':'emp',%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009'lifestyles':'lfs',%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009'materials':'mat',%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009'social impacts':'sip',%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009'transboundary':'trb',%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009'transport':'tra'%%00010}%%00010mod_tri = trigrams.get(flow_variables['module'])%%00010#--------------------#%%00010#OUTPUT TABLE 1 = OTS%%00010#--------------------#%%00010# the filepath is made by retrieving the global variables from the KNIME environment ('right-click>KNIME variables' on the KNIME workflow)%%00010filepath = flow_variables['knime.workspace']+'/'+datafolder+'/ots_'+mod_tri+"_"+flow_variables['name']+".xlsx"%%00010%%00010# read the excel files%%00010xl = pd.ExcelFile(filepath)#excel file containing data%%00010md = pd.ExcelFile(filepath.split(".",1)[0]+'_md.xlsx')#excel file containing metadata%%00010l = len(xl.sheet_names)#number of sheets%%00010%%00010# retrieve metadatas%%00010metadata = md.parse('metadata')%%00010metadata = metadata.set_index('name')%%00010title = metadata.loc['Title'].value%%00010unit = metadata.loc['Unit'].value%%00010category = metadata.loc['data type'].value%%00010levername = metadata.loc['Variable'].value%%00010%%00010levername_column = "lever_"+levername%%00010%%00010%%00009%%00010init = 0%%00010# loop through all the excel sheets%%00010for i in range(0,l):%%00010%%00009df = xl.parse(xl.sheet_names[i])#parsing the data of the sheet inside a dataframe%%00010%%00009filter_col = [col for col in list(df) if col != 'Country']#selecting all the columns that are not 'Country'. Those columns are the values of my pivot table.%%00010%%00009df = pd.melt(df, id_vars=['Country'], value_vars=filter_col ,var_name='Years',value_name=category+"_"+levername+"_"+xl.sheet_names[i]+"["+unit+"]")#pivoting the columns using 'Country' as pivot.%%00010%%00009if init == 0:%%00010%%00009%%00009output_table_1 = df%%00010%%00009%%00009init = 1%%00010%%00009else:%%00010%%00009%%00009output_table_1 = pd.merge(output_table_1, df, on=['Country','Years'])%%00010#--------------------#%%00010#OUTPUT TABLE 2 = LL%%00010#--------------------#%%00010# the filepath is made by retrieving the global variables from the KNIME environment ('right-click>KNIME variables' on the KNIME workflow)%%00010filepath = flow_variables['knime.workspace']+'/'+datafolder+'/ll_'+mod_tri+"_"+flow_variables['name']+".xlsx"%%00010%%00010# read the excel files%%00010xl = pd.ExcelFile(filepath)#excel file containing data%%00010md = pd.ExcelFile(filepath.split(".",1)[0]+'_md.xlsx')#excel file containing metadata%%00010l = len(xl.sheet_names)#number of sheets%%00010%%00010# retrieve metadatas%%00010metadata = md.parse('metadata')%%00010metadata = metadata.set_index('name')%%00010title = metadata.loc['Title'].value%%00010unit = metadata.loc['Unit'].value%%00010category = metadata.loc['data type'].value%%00010levername = metadata.loc['Variable'].value%%00010%%00010levername_column = "lever_"+levername%%00010flow_variables["levername_column"] = levername_column%%00010%%00010init = 0%%00010# loop through all the excel sheets%%00010for i in range(0,l):%%00010%%00009df = xl.parse(xl.sheet_names[i])#parsing the data of the sheet inside a dataframe%%00010%%00009filter_col = [col for col in list(df) if col.startswith('2')]#selecting all the columns that start with '2'. Those columns are the values of the pivot table. WARNING: if the name of the column are not converted in STRINGS, there will be an error running this line. To convert to string, 2 options: 1. str(col).startwith() 2. df.Years = df.Years.astype(str) %%00010%%00009df = pd.melt(df, id_vars=['Country', 'Level'], value_vars=filter_col ,var_name='Years',value_name=category+"_"+levername+"_"+xl.sheet_names[i]+"["+unit+"]")%%00010%%00009if init == 0:%%00010%%00009%%00009output_table_2 = df%%00010%%00009%%00009init = 1%%00010%%00009else:%%00010%%00009%%00009output_table_2 = pd.merge(output_table_2, df, on=['Country','Level','Years'])%%00010%%00010output_table_2.rename(columns = {'Level':levername_column}, inplace = True)%%00010
